_meanings:
{@--4@} Wrongly, 
erroneously, badly, as in {#anyaTAsidDa#} <ab>q. v.</ab>
below; see under {1} also.

{%<ab>adv.</ab>%} in a different
manner, differently <ls>P. III. 4. 27.</ls>

{1} erroneous conception
of the Spirit, title of a 
philosophical work.

speaking differently or falsely; speaking 

falsely or inconsistently; (in law) a
prevaricator, prevaricating witness.

proved or demonstrated wrongly; (in
Nyāya) said of a cause ({#kAraRa#}) which
is not the true one, but only refers
to accidental and remote 
circumstances (as the ass employed to
fetch clay &c. in the case of a {#Gawa#}
or jar) which do not invariably
contribute to the result, see {#kAraRa#};
this {#anyaTA°#} is said to be of 3
kinds in <ls>Tarka K.</ls>, but 5 are 
mentioned in <ls>Bhāṣā P. 19-22</ls>.

wrong demonstration; one
in which arguments, not being true
causes, are advanced; an unessential
cause, an accidental or concomitant
circumstance <ls>Bhāṣā P. 16.</ls>
